data.title: 3 Things Alphabet Investors Should Watch Ahead of Its Earnings Report
data.text: The Google parent will report third quarter results on Oct. 29.

data.title: Justice Department's antitrust chief Makan Delrahim on Big Tech regulation
data.text: Makan Delrahim, Assistant Attorney General for the Anti-Trust Division, joins "Squawk on the Street" to discuss Big Tech regulation and antitrust policy amid the controversy behind Facebook and Twitter's decision to limit a New York Post article about the son of Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden. He also discusses the future of 5G.

data.title: Does Stolen Fruit Taste Better? Check Out My Purloined Portfolio
data.text: Major League Baseball punished the Houston Astros for the way they stole opponents' signs. But there's no penalty for an investment manager stealing ideas from another manager.

data.title: Japan joining forces with US and Europe to regulate Big Tech
data.text: Japan is joining the fight against Big Tech's market dominance. The head of the country's antitrust watchdog said Monday that it would be teaming up with the US and Europe to tackle efforts to regulate the four biggest names in Silicon Valley, adding that Tokyo could open a probe into Google's attempted Fitbit merger.

data.title: Google Cloud launches Lending DocAI, its first dedicated mortgage industry tool
data.text: Google Cloud today announced the launch of Lending DocAI, its first dedicated service for the mortgage industry. The tool, which is now in preview, is meant to help mortgage companies speed up the process of evaluating a borrower's income and asset documents, using specialized machine learning models to automate routine document reviews.

data.title: 4 Perfect Stocks to Buy if the Stock Market Crashes
data.text: Stock market crashes and corrections are inevitable -- but they do open the door to some incredible bargains for investors.

data.title: FANG Stock Alphabet Gets Some Bite Back; Closing On Key Rating Benchmark
data.text: Alphabet shows improving price performance, earning an upgrade to its IBD Relative Strength Rating. The post FANG Stock Alphabet Gets Some Bite Back; Closing On Key Rating Benchmark appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.
